goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
indicator_name: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment
graph_title: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment
goal_name: 9: Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
target_name: 9.2:  Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry's share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries
indicator_name1: 9.2.2: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment
organization_name: National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic (Labour and Employment Statistics Division)
definitions: Manufacturing employment as a proportion of total employment, expressed in percentages
rationale_interpretation: This indicator represents the contribution of manufacturing in job creation.
data_sources: Integrated Household Budget and Labour Force Sample Survey (Form №4 "Employment and unemployment")
data_collection: The survey is conducted by interviewers visiting households and recording data in tablets based on questionnaires approved by the National Statistical Committee of the Kyrgyz Republic. During household visits, responses can be obtained both from respondents and other household members if the respondent is absent at the time of interview. 5,016 households have been selected for the survey on a quarterly basis. The annual sample rotation is 25 per cent.
computation_methods: To calculate this indicator (according to ILO employment definitions), data on total employment by economic activity are required. These data are collected nationally through the Integrated Household Budget and Labour Force Sample Survey.
quality_assurance: Data quality is ensured by the Integrated Household Budget and Labour Force Sample Survey organized in accordance with international recommendations
data_availability_gaps: NSC KR collects the data through the Integrated Household Budget and Labour Force Sample Survey.
disaggregation: by sex, regional and city level (Bishkek and Osh), economic activity
international_comparability: Data collected are comparable across countries as the Integrated Household Budget and Labour Force Sample Survey organized in accordance with international recommendations
